cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 460 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west toward the north-western Bahamas, then turning WNW across the Florida Peninsula, crossing near the east-central coast late Wednesday night, emerging over or very near the north-east Gulf coast and then lifting north-north-westward into Georgia and the south-east U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central coast of Florida between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County line

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to the Ochlockonee River, including Tampa Bay and Port Manatee area
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Boca Raton to Flagler/Volusia County Line (Atlantic coast); Tropical-Storm Warning Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL and Flagler/Volusia County Line FL to Altamaha Sound GA – none of these include Port Manatee
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida Peninsula, including west-central Florida and Tampa Bay shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Potential for sustained tropical-storm-force winds (39–50 mph) with a cumulative 53 % chance; gusts could exceed 60 mph, especially Thursday morning.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible along Tampa Bay, including Port Manatee, beginning late Wednesday night through Thursday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with locally higher amounts; risk of flash and urban flooding around the port and nearby low-lying terminals.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very rough seas and dangerous rip currents in Tampa Bay approaches; minor coastal erosion possible at port entrance channel.
